Package com.example.scanpal

Class UserController

java.lang.Object
com.example.scanpal.UserController
public class UserController extends Object
Manages user data interactions with a Firestore database, including adding, updating, and fetching user details.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructor
    Description
    UserController(com.google.firebase.firestore.FirebaseFirestore database, android.content.Context context)
    Initializes a new UserController instance.

  • Constructor Details

    • UserController

      public UserController(com.google.firebase.firestore.FirebaseFirestore database, android.content.Context context)
      Initializes a new UserController instance.
      Parameters:
      database - The Firestore database instance used for user operations.
      context - The application's context, used for file operations.

  • Method Details

    • addUser

      public void addUser(User user, UserAddCallback callback)
      Adds a new user to the Firestore database and stores a local copy. If the username already exists in the database, an error is reported through the callback.
      Parameters:
      user - The User object to add to the database.
      callback - The callback to report success or failure.

    • updateUser

      public void updateUser(User user, UserUpdateCallback callback)
      Updates an existing user's details in the Firestore database and updates the local copy.
      Parameters:
      user - The User object with updated details.
      callback - The callback to report success or failure.

    • getUser

      public void getUser(String username, UserFetchCallback callback)
      Fetches a user's details from the Firestore database. If the user is not found in Firestore, attempts to retrieve a local copy.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the user to fetch.
      callback - The callback to report the fetched user or failure.

    • removeUser

      public void removeUser(String username, UserRemoveCallback callback)
      Removes a user from the Firestore database and deletes the local copy.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the user to remove.
      callback - The callback to report success or failure.

    • isUsernameTaken

      public void isUsernameTaken(String username, UsernameCheckCallback callback)
      Checks if the provided username already exists in the Firestore database.
      Parameters:
      username - The username to check.
      callback - The callback to report the result of the check.

    • fetchStoredUsername

      public String fetchStoredUsername()
      Retrieves the stored username from internal storage.
      Returns:
      The stored username, or null if an error occurs.

    • isUserLoggedIn

      public boolean isUserLoggedIn()
      Check internal storage to see if user object exists.
      Returns:
      true if user object exists in internal storage, false if not.
